alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 11:27AM EDT until July 11 at 10:19PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Vermont... Mad River At Moretown affecting Washington County. For the Winooski River...including Moretown, Montpelier, Waterbury, Essex Junction...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mad River at Moretown. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, At 9 feet, the mad river begins to leave its banks. Field flooding occurs between Waitsfield and Moretown, and some local roads will flood. At 12.0 feet, At 12 feet, Route 100 will be covered with water in Moretown, and Route 100B will be partially covered. Water will inundate Telephone Flats near Waitsfield. At 13.5 feet, About 4 feet of water will cover Route 100 south of Moretown, nearly reaching a trailer park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Monday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EDT Monday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 01/24/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EDT.
